name: Cochineal
description: A natural red colour derived from the bodies of pregnant scale insects.

name: Gelatine
description: A thickening, stabilising emulsifying agent made by boiling animal (usually cattle or pigs) skin, ligaments, bones, sinews or other tissue.

name: Sodium Caseinate
description: An emulsifier, stabiliser & binder, derived from cow’s milk.

name: Bone Phosphate
description: An anti-caking agent made from the degreased steam-extract from animal bones.

name: Beeswax (white & yellow)
description: A glazing and polishing agent made from bee honeycomb.

name: Shellac
description: Glazing agent obtained from the resin produced by the lac insect.

name: Lanolin
description: A yellow waxy substance extracted from sheep’s wool.

name: Lactic Acid
description: Lactic acid is bitter-tasting acid that forms when certain bacteria combine with lactose (milk or sugar). It is used to impart a tart flavour, as well as in the preservation of some foods. It occurs naturally in the souring of milk and can be found in foods such as cheese (used in coagulation) and yogurt. It’s also used in the production of acid-fermented foods such as pickles and sauerkraut.

name: Lecithin
description: An emulsifier (which allows water & oils to mix); is mostly derived from soy beans, seeds, peanuts and maize. Although it may be derived from eggs, in this form it is declared as ‘egg yolk’ and not as ‘322’.

name: Sodium Lactate
description: A derivative of lactic acid.

name: Potassium Lactate
description: A derivative of lactic acid.

name: Calcium Lactate
description: A derivative of lactic acid.

name: Ammonium Lactate
description: A derivative of lactic acid.

name: Magnesium Lactate
description: A derivative of lactic acid.

name: Glycerol/Glycerin
description: May be produced from animal fats, synthesised from propylene or from fermentation of sugars.

name: Mono- and Di-Glycerides of Fatty Acids
Polyglycerol Esters of Interesterified Ricinoleic Acid
Lactylated Fatty Acid Esters of Glycerol and Propane-1,2 Diol
Disodium 5′-Guanylate
description: A flavour enhancer, isolated from sardines or yeast extract.

name: Disodium Inosinate
description: A flavour enhancer, often prepared from meat extract and dried sardines. It can also be a synthetic product made via a microbial synthesis process that begins with a vegetable source.

name: Sodium 5′-Ribonucleotides
description: Flavour enhancer.

name: L-Cysteine
description: A flour treatment agent that can be extracted from duck and chicken feathers.

name: L-Cysteine Monohydrochloride
description: L-Cysteine is a flour treatment agent that can be extracted from duck and chicken feathers.

name: L-Cysteine Hydrochloride Monohydrate
description: L-Cysteine is a flour treatment agent that can be extracted from duck and chicken feathers.

name: Glycerol Mono-, Di- and Tri-Acetate or Tracetin
